analyzed: theḥ apadāna  eka pad umiya vagga
translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Ekapundarika
In the past, twenty-one eons ago,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the three flowers.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā tikiṅkaṇipūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā tikiṅkaṇipūjakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Tikiṅkaṇipūjaka recited these verses.
The Elder Tikiṅkaṇipūjaka’s Story is the fourth.
